we these women from the Korea community
have been married for 15 years the
elderly one is 60 years and the younger
one 35 Kwami Rinna's is during awkward
in our culture women cannot inherit
property so I looked for a wife to help
so when I die they can inherit the
family property she helped me to farm
fetch water graze the cattle and other
household chores do where guest has no
male children and so after her husband
passed away she was left with no heir to

took me on three as her wife to solve

since I was taken in as her wife I feel
like life is normal
she introduced me to her brother-in-law

now but guess his nephew has his own

be the biological father of the six

and four goes all parental rights his
reward is that through his children with
neons we his late uncle's family name
will be carried on but increasingly the
culture of women marrying women is being
used as an escape for domestic violence
UN figures show that northern mera
region has the highest recorded rates of
violence against women in the country
with 60% of women here reported to
experience either physical or emotional
violence the elders here have come to
accept this as a consideration for
adapting the tradition health issues
also come into play there have been
reports of women in such arrangements
changing sexual partners frequently Oh
mom oh no no we tell the women to be
careful which meant they pick for their
wives they shouldn't pick men that are
promiscuous their diseases now and if
she's infected it would be difficult for
the family to look after her these
arranged marriages between women in the
Korea community have empowered both
older and younger
women who agree to them to take control
of their own lives men play a part but
its secondary some traditions weaken
over time but this one isn't in danger
